Article Title: Measuring Happiness of US Cities by Mining Usergenerated Text in Flickr.com: A Pilot Analysis.
Author: You, Sukjin; DesArmo, Joel; Joo, Soohyung
Journal Title: Proceedings of the Association for Information Science & Technology
Subjects: Data mining; Flickr.com (Company); Happiness; Cities & towns -- United States; Prediction (Logic); Criminal statistics
Keywords: Flickr.com; happiness index; social media mining; text mining
Abstract: This poster describes a methodology to numerically represent the happiness of a city by mining user generated terms in Flickr.com. As a pilot analysis, we collected 15,000 text records consisting of titles, tags, descriptions, and comments for the thirty most populous cities in the United States. Parsed text was utilized to calculate happiness scores (H-Score) by matching text extracted from Flickr.com with a happiness index dictionary. In addition, we examined the relationships between the calculated Hscores and real world phenomena including population, crime rate, and climate. Based on this pilot analysis, a future study is planed that involves a large dataset with prediction analysis.
